docTitle.titlePart:
Opinion of the Scientific Panel on Additives and Products or
Substances used in Animal Feed on a request from the Commission on
the safety of the product "Kemzyme W Dry" regarding the ability of
Bacillus strains involved in the manufacture to produce toxins

front.div:
SUMMARY
The additive "Kemzyme W dry" consists of a mixture of five enzymes including an Î±-
amylase produced by Bacillus amyloliquefaciens (DSM 9553) and bacillolysin produced by
Bacillus amyloliquefaciens (DSM 9554). The European Food Safety Authority received a
request to assess the safety of the additive with particular regard to the ability of the
Bacillus production strains to produce toxins. Information provided by the company showed
that the results for the toxicity assays were negative, and no immunological cross reactivity
with B. cereus enterotoxins was observed. Therefore, the Panel on Additives and Products
or Substances used in Animal Feed is satisfied that the production strains DSM 9553 and
DSM 9554 when used as a source of extracellular enzyme do not present a toxigenic risk.
front.keyword: Key words: Kemzyme W Dry, enzymes, chickens for fattening, Bacillus toxins
